EmailTemplate.name: Trial FTU - Day 14 (Activating Paypal)
EmailTemplate.subject: Enable payments, how to videos, welcome guide, webinars and more...
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Enable payments, how to videos, welcome guide, webinars and more... View online
Say goodbye to chasing late payments
Intuit QuickBooks Online is enabling small businesses to accept online invoice payments from their clients in an easy and convenient way by partnering with PayPal. GET STARTED NOW
Let's get started with an overview of Accept payments with PayPal:
1. An easy and convenient way to get paid
Send invoices from QuickBooks Online with a "Pay Now" link, so customers can make instant online payments via PayPal, credit cards or debit cards.
SEE HOW TO USE IT
2. Securely import your PayPal sales transactions, fees and taxes
Once you allow QuickBooks Online to access your PayPal account, your data will import every day. You also have an option to import up to 18 months of past transactions.
LEARN MORE
3. Sales receipts created
We'll create sales receipts in QuickBooks Online for you, while syncing other key details including amount of sale, fees and taxes from your PayPal account.
FIND OUT MORE
Accept payments with PayPal tip
Your expenses are downloaded from your PayPal Account into default categories within your QuickBooks Online account.
Take a quick tour.
Learn how to set-up Payments in your QuickBooks Online account and raise invoices with "Pay now" button.
SEE IT IN ACTION
Or get started now.
Download Accept Payments with PayPal Welcome Guide to get up to speed on how to start accepting payments with PayPal using QuickBooks Online
DOWNLOAD NOW
Want to learn more?
Check out our FREE training.
We're here to help you advance your knowledge to start accepting payments using QuickBooks Online with our 60 mins pre-recorded webinar.
WATCH HERE
GET STARTED NOW
The PayPal service is provided by PayPal Australia Pty Limited (ABN 93 111 195 389) which holds Australian Financial Services Licence number 304962. Any information provided is general only and does not take into account your objectives, financial situation or needs. Please read and consider the Combined Financial Services Guide and Product Disclosure Statement at paypal.com.au before acquiring or using the service.
intuit.com.au
